intro: Apurimacia dolichocarpa, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are often hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are erect and branched. Apurimacia dolichocarpa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
